Reviews.Title: I LOVE this phone
Reviews.Author: T-MILLZ
Reviews.Content: This is the first Android phone I've ever bought and its amazing. I'll never use a regular cellphone again. HTC has done a fantastic job at producing these android cellular devices.Packaging10/10Simply wonderful. It came in the full retail TMOBILE case enclosed with:T-MOBILE MyTouch 3gUSB Wall chargerEar budsScreen protectorPhone Design10/10Sleek and smooth. Fits right into your hand. The back cover is easy to remove and put back on. Battery, SIM CARD, and Micro-SD card are all easy to access. The phone has a HOME, MENU, CALL START, BACK, SEARCH, CALL END/POWER UP button, and a highly responsive track ball.Battery Life9/101350 mAhHolds a very decent chargeYou can make it last 8-10 hours depending on how you use itKeyboard10/10It took me some getting use to, but I've finally learned to manipulate this keyboard to my will. The phone comes installed with SWYPE. The keyboard can go portrait and landscape mode during SMS texting and web browsing.SPECS9/10The phone has:528 Mhz processor512 MB flash memory200 MB RAMNot the best but its not the worst. This is the second android phone by T-Mobile it won't be like newer ones.Overall Rating9/10Very responsive, ENTRY LEVEL android phone. If your looking for a good device that wont cost you over half a thousand dollars, I'd purchase this product.:)

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: southerntexasbelle
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone about 3 weeks ago. I went from a Blackberry Curve to this one so I consider it a huge step up. I love this phone. There are some pros and cons to it.PROS: It's not too big like most of the Android phones these days. I also got an OTA update a day after having it which updated the OS to the latest version of Android. I like that it's fully customizable. The way the gallery sets up pictures and videos is pretty awesome. It runs pretty smoothly. I also love the Android market so far.CONS: The battery can sometimes die within a few hours even if you have all your apps off. This is probably due to the fact that the display is on a lot cause I use it all the time. Every now and again it moves a little slow when navigating through it, especially if you are playing music through the music player and trying to do something else on it. After taking a couple pictures in a row, the camera freezes up. It pops up with a message saying that it could not connect to camera. To fix this I have to turn the phone off and then turn it back on. For some reason if it's laying down on a flat surface, it wont always pick up that I'm touching the screen and trying to do something. I haven't figured out why it has done this yet.Over all I really like this phone. It is easy to use, fits perfectly in my hand and allows me to do the things that I need to do on it. No it's not the newest phone out there but it compares pretty well to most of them.

Reviews.Title: My Touch 3g
Reviews.Author: fallon93
Reviews.Content: I recieved the phone a few days before the expected arrival date which was great! When i recieved the phone i was extremely happy with the quality of it. It works great! came with a case and everything. I give the seller 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Best Touch Screen Smart Phone on the Market
Reviews.Author: M. Drachman
Reviews.Content: I have used this phone for quite some time now and am extremely happy with it. I have used a lot of different touch screen smart phones and this is by far one of the best out there. I would highly recommend this for both personal and business use.

Reviews.Title: Worst Phone I ever had
Reviews.Author: V. Rodriguez "Miss Punky"
Reviews.Content: I think this is my second review on amazon because i never do them but for this one I need to warn people of this crap. I got the Fender edition and since I bought it I had problems with it. First it was because i couldn't use the camera because it didn't read the micro SD. Chatted with a T-Mobile rep and told me to restore the whole phone, I did and it worked for just 2 weeks, also this happened the very first day I bought it! Because I got tired of restoring the phone every time it stopped taking pics, I had to take the sd out and put it in so it would work.But What really completely killed it was this January when finally I got the message saying that I can update to Froyo, I did and was the worst decision ever. It freezes, it doesn't load sometimes, it takes an hour to download a 200+kb app, it shuts down randomly, it over heats, the battery only last 3-4 hours without me using it at all, typing takes forever since it freezes every time you click on a letter and the only thing that can actually works fine is a solitaire app that I downloaded. I even tried to restored the phone but it's still the same and i know other people that got the same problem with their normal mytouch, so it's not because it's the Fender edition.Positive things- well the fender edition is pretty, from the home charger to the earphones (which are uncomfortable as heck) and it had some music apps and like 50 free songs in the memory but because I restored the phone the very fist day I got it, I never heard any of the songs.If you buy it, just don't do the froyo update if it doesn't have it already. But really, don't waste your money on this, it's obsolete by now (and it was obsolete when I bought it cuz a month later the mytouch slider came out and like 3 months after the 4g one) For less than $200 you can get a LG G2x that is way advance than this. That's what I did, my G2x is arriving at my home on Monday :D

Reviews.Title: MyTouch 3g cell phone
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: Phone arrived as scheduled. Price was almost half of what t mobile wanted and worked great with my provider. Bought it for my wife and will probably buy one for myself soon. Not a super techy person but work well for our needs.

Reviews.Title: 3-4 Stars
Reviews.Author: luckymom2010
Reviews.Content: My husband would probably give this product a 2-3 star rating, but I think it is a solid 3. I have had this phone a little less than a week and I'll be honest, I'm not in love. It does what I need it to do, but it does occasionally turn itself off and back on again. I think majority of the problems that i do experience with the phone are because of connection issues. My 3G runs slow and the apps can be temperamental, the key pad when texting has a mind of its own and can lock up on you. We do live in the desert (El Paso, TX) so problems with connection could be due to that. However, on a positive note, this phone was very easy to acclimate to. Just took my Sim card out of my old T-Mobile phone and slid it into this one and that was it. If you are not looking for a super phone, i.e. Droid, EVO, or Iphone, this will probably work for you.

Reviews.Title: my touch cell phone
Reviews.Author: DEE
Reviews.Content: Great phone my daughter love it, the my touch phone work great, no problems at all, I would purchase another one

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Nina
Reviews.Content: Phone wasn shipped super fast. Item was exactly as described. Love love love android. I've had so many phones in my lifetime but this one by far is the best.

Reviews.Title: Not the latest and greatest but still a good buy
Reviews.Author: Jeannine George
Reviews.Content: I bought this because I didn't want to spend a lot for my first smart phone. I have been able to adapt to devices like computers and tablets but have not kept up to date on cell phones. I have been told this phone is obsolete because it is almost 5 years old but I have really liked it in the two weeks I have had it. It does all I need it to do. That battery lasts 2 - 3 days, depending on use, and the sound is better than what I had before. If you are looking for a t--mobile phone without breaking the bank this is still a good choice.

Reviews.Title: Back in the day..
Reviews.Author: Mr. Ninja
Reviews.Content: This was an Awesome phone back in the day. I believe I purchased this in 2009, which was one of those "hottest phones, gotta have it, right now". It was great the first 3 years I owned it. Since 2012, it's been rebooting randomly and the screen sometimes fade in black. The battery life is pretty horrible now, at least 5 hours and that's if I don't even use it. I use the Navigation app a lot and the battery drains in 5 minutes without the charger. I still like it because it does what I want it to do. However, my co-workers don't like me using this phone. They say I respond an hour later to their texts. But an easy solution to that was, calling me instead. It really does test your patience. I'm not a sheep like everyone else buying every new phone after release. That's stupid. This is my first and only android phone. I saved a lot of money throughout the years with this. But I think it's time to upgrade. I purchased this for $500 in 2009. I am now considering the SS Galaxy S4 which I will keep for maybe 8 years.I recommend this to anyone who will use it strictly for Text/Call. But my question to you is.. Why the hell are you looking at an obsolete phone like this?

Reviews.Title: Slow!
Reviews.Author: crystal wightman
Reviews.Content: Works well but it's slow. Might be the 3G but I should have just bought a newer version. If you're looking for a filler phone until you get your upgrade, this will work. Not exciting and not for the avid app user/photo taker.

Reviews.Title: Had to return
Reviews.Author: First Time Mom
Reviews.Content: I didn't get to use it because it was not working out the box. I didn't bother to order it again.

Reviews.Title: It was a nightmare
Reviews.Author: Josephine M Powell
Reviews.Content: Every time I used the phone it powered itself down and I'd have to wait for it to power up again. The second day I got 51 random texts from an unknown user- all nonsense words. And it needed to be charged twice a day.It makes me laugh, actually... how bad it was.But all that being said, the seller was awesome and took it back immediately and Amazon was so professional. Love this site.You get what you pay for- and a cheap refurbished cell phone is not a good investment. :)

Reviews.Title: Bad Phone
Reviews.Author: Shanta hanna
Reviews.Content: this phone to small and it stop charging,,,,,Now I got to buy another phone....I will not purchase anything else from your company......!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: Kimberly
Reviews.Content: I am still getting used to texting on the touch screen.  reasonable price and works well for what I need.

Reviews.Title: Great phone for 2 years
Reviews.Author: Team Mom "Raffi, Editor of Digital Running"
Reviews.Content: For the last 2 years I have loved this phone. As an on-the-go techie, I have used it for email & Gmail, Google Docs, Facebook, Hootsuite, as a PDF viewer, calendar, for web browsing, and as a Google Map navigator when driving. AND as a phone and camera. I have easily stored over 150 photos on my SD card. I rarely used it as an MP3 player.I have also enjoyed the Swype technology when texting.Now the battery life is only about 5 hours and I can't text photos anymore, so it is time to upgrade. But after 2 years, that seems reasonable.Bye bye MyTouch. You will be missed!

Reviews.Title: works great no problems
Reviews.Author: mcook
Reviews.Content: easiest touch screen to use if you are not used to using one. At 64 even I can understand this one. I love it but it is my last touch screen because the new ones are just to much trouble for me. great seller would buy from again.

Reviews.Title: Phone was not good
Reviews.Author: Maggie Moore
Reviews.Content: My other cell phone stopped working so I ordered this phone. It arrived in a box, no packing around the phone, the back was off the phone and the battery was out. There was no instruction book. The box was taped up and obviously had been used before. On the first day of using it it started getting a pop up note saying I had to force the program to quit or send a report. I could not get this to stop. I called the company that made the phone and they looked up the serial number and the phone was made in 2009 so no warranty from them. They did help me though and I had to reset the whole phone losing anything I had on there. The next day I found out it was not storing any numbers of people I had called or who had called me and that same pop up was there. had to take out the battery to stop this one!The phone itself when it works is very nice but you do need an SD card to make certain features work. The good news is Amazon paid for the shipping to send it back.

Reviews.Title: Terrible.
Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: This is the worst phone I have ever had. I've had two of these because the first one was so buggy that I thought replacing it would fix the problem. Sometimes when I send a text, the other person receives a message of just boxes instead of letters. Google maps works 30% of the time and force quits 70% of the time. Sometimes when I try to place the "d" key it makes the texting stop working. Sometimes the touch screen just stops responding. This phone is terrible.

Reviews.Title: ok phone
Reviews.Author: dustinpierce58
Reviews.Content: this was my first android. i love the phone but mine keeps randomly restarting. it takes forever to download apps. i go on the market and the only way for the app to be actually downloaded is if i stay on the app. otherwise it doesnt install. over all i give the mytouch 3g a 3 and a half.

Reviews.Title: Wanted to love this phone...but didn't
Reviews.Author: Steve G
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to love this phone, but there were a few things that just didn't work right. I know that Google has no control over how HTC builds a phone, but this phone should have never been released with so little processing power. It was really slow to move between screens. Viewing a photo from the library took minutes! The Wi-Fi connection at my house would constantly be "forgotten", very frustrating. Otherwise, it was a pretty good phone. The Android operating system is quite good and will probably become just as good as iOS eventually.

Reviews.Title: Ok Phone
Reviews.Author: Joey A
Reviews.Content: phone works as stated, battery life is decent for a 3g phone. I love the android market that comes with the phone. OS works great for a smartphone, cant complain with my purchase. Track ball is a ok feature though i must say i have never used it. Overall is a good starting phone for someone new to smartphones.

Reviews.Title: Horrible
Reviews.Author: Mishi
Reviews.Content: I remember getting this and being disappointed. It came with the case, charger and other things but the phone was acting weird and didn't read my sim. I had to sell it off. I don't recommend anyone buying from this seller.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: Skyler T. Madison
Reviews.Content: This phone is trash. I went through three of these phones and each one was a disservice. I've had clunky junk phones work much better than this. The touch screen is trash. The phone can't process any information at all. It just lags and freezes on the home (desktop) screen until it tells me the operating system has crashed several times until it finally decides to work like an android device until the next small even occurs and the next application crashes and you try going back to the desktop and it crashes the Android operating system again. This device is slow and ineffective. It was designed to be faulty. Don't buy it. You WILL regret it... it also always has an error saying that it can't load any of the information on the flash drive even when there is no memory being stored on the flash drive... hmmm... And it doesn't matter which of the three phones you have.Like an organized device? Too bad. You'll spend a few minutes organizing your favorite apps wherever you like them and then the next time you return to it, the phone has completely reorganized your apps for you. Customer service is no help because they tell you that all the apps are listed alphabetical... yeah... from the tab you pull up from the bottom. Duh. But what about when you intentionally place them on the desktop or in folders. You can tell them what order they're listen and make it clear as day to them that the phone is not organizing your apps on the desktop even remotely in alphabetical order and they'll still insist that it is.Then they'll tell you to do a master reset. Which defeats the purpose of having a smart phone if all your pertinent information for work is stored on your phone and you're just going to wipe it all out of the picture every weekend. It's not the apps that are doing it to the phone. It's just the phone. It crashes with or without additional apps.Don't get me wrong. Android phones are amazing. I'm happy with one right now. It's THIS phone I have a problem with. T-Mobile, STEP IT UP!

Reviews.Title: Nice work!
Reviews.Author: Leatherface
Reviews.Content: I ordered a phone & got it in a really nice case! Took a few days for it to come, but it came, that's all that matters. Hate that I couldn't track it, but it's cool. 4 thumps up.

Reviews.Title: Came earlier than expected!
Reviews.Author: Perry
Reviews.Content: Came earlier than expected! I was surprised when it came. Only issue was I wanted the black case but came in white. But no big deal.

Reviews.Title: my touch 3g
Reviews.Author: pmom
Reviews.Content: I was only partially satisfied with my purchase but I needed a phone badly so it will do for now

Reviews.Title: Mytouch Review
Reviews.Author: Alejandro Perez III "nperez21"
Reviews.Content: I love this item. Everything I expected and more. I wouldn't ask for anything else.

Reviews.Title: My first smart phone
Reviews.Author: Robin Ratliff "paintarainbow"
Reviews.Content: First off I've been a hard core Nokia fan for 10 years and they have never let me down in quality & durability! However, with the recent explosion of smart phones, touch screens, and the availability of so many features at your fingertips you just can't pass up the intoxicating thought of owning one of these magical gadgets.  My first few ventures out into the smart phone world were not as thrilling as the commercials would like you to think.  I found touch screens very hard to use and slow loading screens, not at all the "wow" factor I was hoping for.  I only chose the MyTouch phone on my husbands urging, as my current Nokia 6130 was starting to get a little shabby after over 3 years of use, and even with the data plan on it (added just this last year) wasn't really doing some of the things I wanted my phone to do very easily (i.e. I could access facebook, weather, news, e-mail and text but not very easily).  Sadly I was outgrowing my phone.  Many friends of mine own iphones and love them but, I just wasn't sure it was right for me.  They seem a little too big, too expensive, I'm not an apple fan, and I love my wallpapers.  This phone was $149 w/ a new 2 yr contract.  I didn't know how I would adjust to such a big jump between my old phone at this one but after having it for a week I'm really enjoying the new phone.  The app store is awesome!  Widgets are fun and functional!  It's my new pocket friend!

Reviews.Title: Amazing Phone
Reviews.Author: Ryan C. Adams
Reviews.Content: I can't tell you how much I love this phone. It seems like dailey I am saying to myself, "good thing I had my phone or i'd have been screwed". There are thousands of great apps, and I have found much use from many of them. The phone itself is very user friendly, and has a lot of easy to use features that seem like a must now when compared to other phones. The touch screen is extremely responsive, and the multi media capabilities are wonderful. Now for those of you who will not be adding the internet to your phone plan: This is a great phone, but without the web service, you will not have access to the apps market, along my favorite app Google maps. So I recomend adding the service to your plan, to fully get the most out of your HTC My Touch.

Reviews.Title: Wish I would have kept my old phone.
Reviews.Author: Gleamthecube45
Reviews.Content: Oh sure, I loved this phone when I first got it. It works great right out of the box. You would expect that. But for something that's supposed to compete with things like the iPhone or other smart phones, this thing sucks. It works great until you actually want to start doing things with it. Try to add a few apps to it, that'll slow it down considerably. Try to multitask, once again, slowed down. Ohhh.. And I won't even start to mention how many times apps crash! Yeah, T-Mobile has great customer service, but once I sent this piece in I got billed $100 for water damage. (Even though the white dot inside the phone was still white!) If I were to sum this review up, I would say: Sure if you want a "smart phone" that you can use for everything a normal phone can do, buy thing thing. But if you want something that's actually "smart," don't even bother. This phone is nothing but a headache. I'm counting the days my contract is up and I can leave T-Mobile's horrible network (They call it 4G when it doesn't even run at 3G speeds!) and get a better provider and phone!

ProductInfo.Features:
3G enabled
Fully Customizable
Fully Integrated Google Search, Maps and G-Mail
One Touch access to email, music, web and more
Thousands of down-loadable applications from the Android Market
ProductInfo.Name: MyTouch 3G Cell Phone (T-Mobile)
